thread.title_full: Stegmaier leads in Vegas as play is suspended - CBSSports.com

title: Stegmaier leads in Vegas as play is suspended - CBSSports.com
text:
Stegmaier leads in Vegas as play is suspended due to darkness by STATS LLC | CBSSports.com wire reports Oct. 23, 2015 9:37 PM ET 
LAS VEGAS -- Brett Stegmaier topped the leaderboard Friday in the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open in only his fifth career start on the PGA Tour. 
The 32-year-old former University of Florida player was 6 under for the round and 11 under overall with three holes left when second-round play was suspended because of darkness. PGA Tour Leaderboard 
Stegmaier eagled the par-5 16th on his opening nine and had four birdies on the 15 holes he was able to finish at TPC Summerlin. He earned a tour card in the Web.com Tour Finals series. 
Former UNLV player Chad Campbell was a stroke back along with Morgan Hoffmann and Tyler Aldridge . The 41-year-old Campbell had a 4-under 67. Hoffmann shot a 66, and Aldridge had a 68. 
Rickie Fowler followed his opening 72 with a 65 to reach 5 under. He eagled the par-5 13th in a back-nine 30. Copyright 2015 by STATS LLC. Any commercial use or distribution without the express written consent of STATS LLC is strictly prohibited.
